text: Alfred Merrill Worden (February 7, 1932 â€“ March 18, 2020) was an American astronaut, engineer and USAF officer. He was the Command Module Pilot for the Apollo 15 lunar mission in 1971. He is one of only 24 people to have flown to the Moon and orbited it 74 times in the Command Module Endeavour. In 1982, Worden ran for the United States House of Representatives in Florida's 12th congressional district but lost the Republican primary to Tom Lewis. He was born Jackson, Michigan. Worden died of a stroke on March 18, 2020 in Sugar Land, Texas. He was 88. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Apollo astronauts Category:Engineers from Michigan Category:Military people from Michigan Category:Deaths from stroke Category:People from Jackson, Michigan Category:Politicians from Michigan Category:Politicians from Florida Category:Scientists from Michigan Category:Scientists from Florida Category:United States Air Force Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Alfred Worden
